channel.title: Comments on: Eager loading for greater good
channel.description: Plataformatec's place to talk about Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Elixir, and software engineering

item.title: By: josevalim
item.dc:creator: josevalim
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/08/eager-loading-for-greater-good/comment-page-1/#comment-1279">divoxx</a>.
I think Matz wanted to deprecate it because it could not be made threadsafe. However, it seems the JRuby guys were able to. I don't know where the proposal to deprecate it stands right now.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to divoxx.

I think Matz wanted to deprecate it because it could not be made threadsafe. However, it seems the JRuby guys were able to. I don’t know where the proposal to deprecate it stands right now.

item.title: By: divoxx
item.dc:creator: divoxx
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/08/eager-loading-for-greater-good/comment-page-1/#comment-1278">trans</a>.
Yeah, as far as I know autoload is deprecated. Has that changed Valim?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to trans.

Yeah, as far as I know autoload is deprecated. Has that changed Valim?

item.title: By: trans
item.dc:creator: trans
item.description: Last I heard autoload was basically deprecated. But it won't be removed for a while, its marked for Ruby 3.0.
item.content:encoded: Last I heard autoload was basically deprecated. But it won’t be removed for a while, its marked for Ruby 3.0.

item.title: By: josevalim
item.dc:creator: josevalim
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/08/eager-loading-for-greater-good/comment-page-1/#comment-1276">Christian Lallemand</a>.
Yes, this is a good point I haven't talked about in the blog post. It will improve Sidekiq (and any other solution depending on threads) too.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Christian Lallemand.

Yes, this is a good point I haven’t talked about in the blog post. It will improve Sidekiq (and any other solution depending on threads) too.

item.title: By: Christian Lallemand
item.dc:creator: Christian Lallemand
item.description: Many thanks for this post ... i think this explains why sidekiq often fails to load my modules
item.content:encoded: Many thanks for this post … i think this explains why sidekiq often fails to load my modules
